subject: RE: [junit] JUnit and EJB! please help, a beginner
msgSnippet: Hello James, In cactus they have a step by step tutorial on how to test EJB s.  If you need some help on learning EJBs and what to test the java.sun.com EJB
messageBody:
Hello James,

In cactus they have a step by step tutorial on how to test EJB's. If you need some help
on learning EJBs and what to test the java.sun.com EJB tutorial is a good place to start.
Here you will come up with some ideas on what to test. EJBs are a quite extensive topic
depending on how you see it, try to focus on something first then expand your knowledge on
the other subjects of EJBs, ie: start with Session EJBs and return a simple "Hello world".

As part of the research project you may want to say that different tools are for different
kinds of test for what I would also look and briefly explain other tools like jmeter, junitperf,
httpunit, etc...

Good luck on your research project sounds like you will have some fun,

--Rene Baltazar Lopez


-----Original Message-----
From: james_khu [mailto:james_khu@...]
Sent: Saturday, April 19, 2003 12:53 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] JUnit and EJB! please help, a beginner


Hi

I am a graduate student at a local university. I was just given a
research project on how to do both unit testing and load testing of
EJB. They told me to explore the possibility of using JUnit to unit
test EJB.

I must say that I am still pretty new at this EJB, tomcat, and
JUnit. my previous programming experience has been java IO,applet,
swing, and some servlet.

Can any of you guys give a pointer on where is the best place to
start looking for simple sample codes to run and play with ? I look
into jakarta.cactus website, but they don;t offer step by step
instructions on how to begin testing ejb. I don't even know how to
pack EAR, WAR, or jar file.

any help would be greatly appreciated
